Iterated Intelligence¶

Implements PGT intelligence for iterSemiNFG objects

Part of: PyNFG - a Python package for modeling and solving Network Form Games

Created on Wed Jan 2 16:33:36 2013

Copyright (C) 2013 James Bono (jwbono@gmail.com)

GNU Affero General Public License

pynfg.pgtsolutions.intelligence.iq_iterated.iq_MC_iter(G, S, X, M, delta, integrand=None, mix=False)[source]¶

Run MC outer loop on random policy sequences for iterSemiNFG IQ calcs

Parameters:
  • G (iterSemiNFG) – the iterated semiNFG to be evaluated
  • S (int) – number of policy sequences to sample
  • X (int) – number of samples of each policy profile
  • M (int) – number of random alt policies to compare
  • delta (float) – the discount factor
  • integrand (func) – a user-supplied function of G that is evaluated for each s in S

Note

This will throw an error if there is a decision node in G.starttime that is not repeated throughout the net.

pynfg.pgtsolutions.intelligence.iq_iterated.iq_MH_iter(G, S, X, M, noise, dens, delta, integrand=None, mix=False)[source]¶

Run MH for iterSemiNFG IQ calcs

Parameters:
  • G (iterSemiNFG) – the iterated semiNFG to be evaluated
  • S (int) – number of MH iterations
  • noise (float) – the degree of independence of the proposal distribution on the current value.
  • dens (func) – the function that assigns weights to iq
  • X (int) – number of samples of each policy profile
  • M (int) – number of random alt policies to compare
  • delta (float) – the discount factor
  • integrand (func) – a user-supplied function of G that is evaluated for each s in S

Note

This will throw an error if there is a decision node in G.starttime that is not repeated throughout the net.

pynfg.pgtsolutions.intelligence.iq_iterated.iq_calc_iter(bn, G, X, M, delta, start)[source]¶

Calc IQ of policy at bn,start in G from the given starting point

Parameters:
  • bn (str) – the basename of the DN to be evaluated
  • G (iterSemiNFG) – the iterated semiNFG to be evaluated
  • X (int) – number of samples of each policy profile
  • M (int) – number of random alt policies with which to compare
  • delta (float) – the discount factor
  • start (int) – the starting time step
pynfg.pgtsolutions.intelligence.iq_iterated.mh_decision(p, q)[source]¶

Decide to accept the new draw or keep the old one

Parameters:
  • p (float) – the unnormalized likelihood of the new draw
  • q (float) – the unnormalized likelihood of the old draw
